q3.description:
Lemma: If
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash_M^* (q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2)$
for string $w$ and
    $(q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
then
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
q3.question: What does this configuration $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1)$ mean?
answer: The read/write head is on the letter $a_1$
choices: The machine is on state $q_1$
The read/write head is on the letter $a_1$

q4.description:
Lemma: If
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash_M^* (q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2)$
for string $w$ and
    $(q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
then
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
q4.question: What do we mean by $\vdash_M^*$?
q4.answer: The machine will do zero or more transitinons
choices: The machine will do zero or more transitinons
The machine will do one transitinons

q5.description:
Lemma: If
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash_M^* (q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2)$
for string $w$ and
    $(q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
then
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
q5.question: What do we mean by $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash_M^* (q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2)$?
answer: The machine will change the state from $q_1$ to $q_2$
The tape content will be modified from $w_1a_1u_1$ to $w_2a_2u_2$
The head will be on the letter $a_2$
choices: The machine will change the state from $q_1$ to $q_2$
The tape content will be modified from $w_1a_1u_1$ to $w_2a_2u_2$
The head will be on the letter $a_2$

q6.description:
Lemma: If
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash_M^* (q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2)$
for string $w$ and
    $(q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
then
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
q6.question: In other words, the machine did some processing on the tape content and modified it accordingly

q7.description:
Lemma: If
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash_M^* (q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2)$
for string $w$ and
    $(q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
then
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
q7.question: What do we mean by $(q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2) \vdash_M^* (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$?
answer: The machine will change the state from $q_2$ to $q_3$
The tape content will be modified from $w_2a_2u_2$ to $w_3a_3u_3$
The head will be on the letter $a_3$
choices: The machine will change the state from $q_2$ to $q_3$
The tape content will be modified from $w_2a_2u_2$ to $w_3a_3u_3$
The head will be on the letter $a_3$

q8.description:
Lemma: If
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash_M^* (q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2)$
for string $w$ and
    $(q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
then
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
q8.question: In other words, the machine did $\textbf{another}$ processing on the tape content and modified it accordingly

q9.description:
Lemma: If
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash_M^* (q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2)$
for string $w$ and
    $(q_2, w_2\underline{a_2}u_2) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
then
    $(q_1, w_1\underline{a_1}u_1) \vdash^*_M (q_3, w_3\underline{a_3}u_3)$
q9.question: So, in general we can say that the machine started at $q_1$ with tape content $w_1a_1u_1$ and did some processing to it and ended at $q_3$ with tape content changed to $w_3a_3u_3$

q13.description:
Here are some basic machines and notation
• $|\Sigma|$ symbol-writing machines (one for each symbol): Any give letter $\sigma$ has a symbol-writing machine named $\sigma$.
q13.question: If $\Sigma = \{a, b\}$, what does the TM $a$ do?
q13.answer: write the letter $a$ to the tape
choices: write the letter $a$ to the tape
$a$ is just a letter in the alphabet set $\Sigma$

q14.description:
Here are some basic machines and notation
• Head-moving machines, named $R$, $L$ and $S$, move the head appropriately.
q14.question: What does the TM $R$ do?
q14.answer: This TM moves the head to the Right
choices: This TM moves the head to the Right
This TM moves the head to the Left
This TM makes the head Stay on the current cell

q15.description:
Here are some basic machines and notation
• Transitions on anything other than (for example) $#$ are labeled $\overline{\#}$
q15.question: What does a tranistion labled with $\overline{a}$ mean?
q15.answer: Change the state if the TM machine reads anything except $a$
choices: Change the state if the TM machine reads anything except $a$
Change the state if the TM machine reads $a$

q16.description:
Here are some basic machines and notation
• Multiple copies of a machine get a superscript
q16.question: $R^3$ means move the read/write head to the right 3 times

q18.question: Which machine will be done first?

q19.question: Which machine will be done after $M_1$ end execution and the current tape cell contains $a$?

q20.question: Which machine will be done after $M_1$ end execution and the current tape cell contains $b$?

q21.question: What this machine do?
q21.answer: Move the head right until an empty cell is found
choices: Move the head right until an empty cell is found
Move the head right until a non-empty cell is found

q22.description:
Consider this example
We will use the notation $R_#$ for this process.
q22.question: What $R_#$ machine do?
q22.answer: Move the head right until an empty cell is found
choices: Move the head right until an empty cell is found
Move the head right until a non-empty cell is found

q23.question: What this machine do?
answer: Move the head left until an empty cell is found
Once the empty cell is reached, the machine $M$ will run
choices: Move the head left until an empty cell is found
Once the empty cell is reached, the machine $M$ will run

q24.description:
Consider this example
We will use the notation $L_#$ for the Machine that will go left until it finds an empty cell.
q24.question: What the machine on the right of the vertical line do?
answer: Move the head left until an empty cell is found
Once the empty cell is reached, the machine $M$ will run
choices: Move the head left until an empty cell is found
Once the empty cell is reached, the machine $M$ will run
